item.title: Home Lab Part 4: Shrinking/Consolidating Home Lab
item.description: To continue the series of posts I made: Home Lab Part 1: Why build one? Home Lab Part 2: Skills and resources before build one Home Lab Part 3: Buildinf the first version of my Home Lab And before getting into the server upgrade details, I started to consolidate and optimize the space usage of my home lab; all the devices I had in the rack were short-deep appliances, between 9” deep and some of them even less.

item.title: Home Lab Part 3: Building the first version of my home lab
item.description: After the prelude of the previous posts: Home Lab Part 1: Why build one? Home Lab Part 2: Skills and resources before build one Now its time to share the experiences I had while building my home lab. Keep in mind that I began this project back in March 2016. First, I set a group of criteria during the planing of the build of the equipment I wanted to use in the first iteration of my server.
